intro: Lesquerella calderi, commonly known as the Caldeira lesquerella, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, narrow leaves adapted to its cold and arid environment. It is known for its unique seed oil, which contains compounds used in industrial applications. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
